text: Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
Elephants can recognize themselves in mirrors.
Dolphins have names for each other.
Honeybees can see ultraviolet light.
Penguins propose to their mates with pebbles.
Cats have a third eyelid called a nictitating membrane.
Sharks have been around longer than trees.
A shrimp's heart is in its head.
Butterflies taste with their feet.
The Great Wall of China took over 2,000 years to build.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid.
The shortest war in history lasted only 38-45 minutes.
Napoleon was actually average height for his time.
The ancient Romans used urine as mouthwash.
Vikings never actually wore horned helmets.
The first computer bug was an actual bug.
Ancient Egyptians used moldy bread as medicine.
The Eiffel Tower was originally intended to be temporary.
Bubble wrap was originally invented as wallpaper.
The Library of Alexandria was gradually declined rather than destroyed in a single event.
Julius Caesar was kidnapped by pirates and later crucified them.
The first person to survive going over Niagara Falls in a barrel was a 63-year-old teacher.
Benjamin Franklin wanted the turkey to be America's national bird.
A day on Venus is longer than its year.
There are more possible games of chess than atoms in the observable universe.
Jupiter's Great Red Spot is a storm larger than Earth.
Saturn would float in water if there was a bathtub big enough.
The Sun makes up 99.86% of the Solar System's mass.
Neutron stars are so dense that a teaspoon would weigh 6 billion tons.
The Milky Way galaxy is on a collision course with Andromeda.
There's a planet made entirely of diamond.
The footprints on the Moon will last millions of years.
Space is completely silent because there's no air to carry sound.
The International Space Station travels at 17,500 mph.
Mars has the largest volcano in the solar system.
The coldest place in the universe is on Earth in a laboratory.
Light from the Sun takes 8 minutes and 20 seconds to reach Earth.
Your body produces 25 million new cells every second.
Humans share 60% of their DNA with bananas.
The human brain uses 20% of the body's total energy.
Your stomach gets an entirely new lining every 3-5 days.
Humans are the only animals that blush.
Your heart beats about 100,000 times per day.
The human eye can distinguish about 10 million colors.
Fingernails grow faster than toenails.
The human body contains about 37.2 trillion cells.
Your brain is about 75% water.
Humans can survive longer without food than without sleep.
The liver can regenerate itself completely.
Human bones are stronger than steel by weight.
The human nose can detect over 1 trillion different scents.
Your body produces about 1.5 liters of saliva daily.
The word 'set' has the most different meanings in English.
There are over 7,000 languages spoken in the world today.
The longest word in English has 189,819 letters.
Shakespeare invented over 1,700 words.
The most translated book is the Bible.
Sign languages are full languages with their own grammar.
The word 'alphabet' comes from the first two Greek letters.
Some languages have no words for left and right.
The dot over a lowercase 'i' or 'j' is called a tittle.
English has borrowed words from over 350 languages.
The shortest complete sentence in English is 'Go!'
There are languages with only a few hundred speakers left.
Some languages read from right to left.
Honey never spoils - archaeologists have found edible honey in ancient Egyptian tombs.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't.
Chocolate was once used as currency.
The most expensive spice in the world is saffron.
Carrots were originally purple.
Peanuts aren't nuts - they're legumes.
The hottest part of a chili pepper is not the seeds but the white pith.
Vanilla is the second most expensive spice after saffron.
Tomatoes were once thought to be poisonous.
The fear of cooking is called mageirocophobia.
Apples float because they're 25% air.
The world's most consumed beverage after water is tea.
Lobsters were once considered poor people's food.
Russia spans 11 time zones.
The Pacific Ocean is larger than all land masses combined.
Antarctica is the world's largest desert.
The Dead Sea is actually a lake.
Mount Everest grows about 4mm taller each year.
The Amazon River is longer than the distance from New York to Rome.
Australia is wider than the Moon.
The Sahara Desert is expanding.
There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way.
The deepest point on Earth is the Mariana Trench.
Africa is splitting into two continents.
The shortest place name is 'Y' in France.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.
The equator passes through 13 countries.
Greenland is closer to North America than Europe.
Water can exist in three states simultaneously at its triple point.
A single bolt of lightning contains enough energy to toast 100,000 slices of bread.
Diamonds can be made from peanut butter.
The human body glows in the dark, but the light is too weak to see.
Hot water freezes faster than cold water under certain conditions.
Glass is actually a liquid, not a solid.
The speed of light is exactly 299,792,458 meters per second.
Absolute zero is -273.15°C or -459.67°F.
Sound travels faster through solids than through air.
The Earth's core is as hot as the Sun's surface.
Magnets have two poles that cannot be separated.
Time moves slower in stronger gravitational fields.
The smallest unit of matter that retains chemical properties is an atom.
Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed.
Light behaves as both a wave and a particle.
In Japan, it's considered rude to blow your nose in public.
The number 4 is considered unlucky in many East Asian cultures.
In some cultures, pointing with your index finger is considered rude.
The concept of personal space varies greatly between cultures.
Some cultures have no concept of exact time.
In Tibet, sticking out your tongue is a greeting.
The color white is associated with mourning in some cultures.
Some cultures believe that taking photos steals your soul.
In some places, it's polite to burp after a meal.
The concept of privacy varies dramatically across cultures.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is 13 seconds.
The world's oldest known living tree is over 5,000 years old.
The fastest recorded sneeze traveled at 100 mph.
The largest snowflake ever recorded was 15 inches wide.
The deepest a human has ever dived without equipment is 831 feet.
The longest hiccuping fit lasted 68 years.
The most lightning strikes survived by one person is 7.
The oldest message in a bottle was found after 132 years.
The largest hailstone ever recorded weighed nearly 2 pounds.
The fastest land animal can reach 70 mph.
The loudest sound ever recorded was the Krakatoa volcanic eruption.
The highest temperature ever recorded on Earth was 134°F.
The wheel was invented around 3500 BCE.
The printing press was invented in 1440.
The telephone was invented in 1876.
The light bulb was perfected in 1879.
The airplane was invented in 1903.
The television was invented in the 1920s.
The computer was developed in the 1940s.
The internet was created in the 1960s-70s.
The mobile phone was invented in 1973.
The World Wide Web was invented in 1989.
Velcro was inspired by burr seeds sticking to dog fur.
The microwave oven was invented by accident.
Post-it Notes were created from a failed adhesive experiment.
The pacemaker was invented after a mistake in building a heart rhythm recorder.
Super Glue was discovered by accident twice.
A soccer ball has 32 panels.
Basketball was invented using peach baskets.
The Olympic Games were first held in ancient Greece in 776 BCE.
Golf balls have dimples to help them fly farther.
The fastest recorded tennis serve was 163.7 mph.
A marathon is exactly 26.2 miles long.
The Super Bowl is the most watched TV event in the US.
Soccer is the most popular sport in the world.
The first modern Olympics had only 43 events.
Baseball's 'seventh-inning stretch' tradition started in 1910.
The Stanley Cup is the oldest professional sports trophy.
Swimming is one of the few sports that uses almost every muscle.
The Tour de France covers about 2,200 miles.
Boxing matches were originally fought bare-knuckled.
The first computer took up an entire room.
The first email was sent in 1971.
The first website is still online today.
Google processes over 8.5 billion searches per day.
The first iPhone was released in 2007.
There are more mobile phones than people on Earth.
The first video uploaded to YouTube was 'Me at the zoo'.
Facebook was originally called 'The Facebook'.
The first computer virus was created in 1971.
WiFi stands for nothing - it's not an acronym.
The '@' symbol was used in emails for the first time in 1971.
Bluetooth is named after a 10th-century Danish king.
The first banner ad had a 44% click-through rate.
Moore's Law states that computer processing power doubles every two years.
The first smartphone was released in 1992.
The 21st century began on January 1, 2001, not 2000.
9/11 changed air travel security forever.
The Human Genome Project was completed in 2003.
Facebook was founded in 2004.
YouTube was created in 2005.
The iPhone revolutionized smartphones in 2007.
The 2008 financial crisis was the worst since the Great Depression.
Barack Obama was the first African American US President (2009).
The Arab Spring began in 2010.
Osama bin Laden was killed in 2011.
The COVID-19 pandemic began in 2019.
Climate change became a major global concern in the 21st century.
Cryptocurrency was invented in 2008 with Bitcoin.
Social media transformed how people communicate.
Streaming services changed how we consume entertainment.
